description.text: It looks like a rice ball, smells like a rice ball, tastes like a rice ball and even feels like one, but the higher-ups say it's a jelly donut and that's what it'll be.
If this is what this newfangled 'fusion cuisine' is producing, you want no part of it. Like elves and dwarves, there are some things that shouldn't be mixed.
A blue orange. Well, you've seen stranger things in your time. Fills your belly a little.
What it says on the label, a jar of honey. Spread it on bread, candies or trees for best results.
Tangy and crisp, this berry is a delight to eat. Fills your belly somewhat.
It's a poffin creatively shaped like a pie. Both children and adults enjoy eating it to fill their bellies.
Eating this won't just fill your Belly, it'll also restore a little PP.
It's boiled tofu in boiled greens, a vegan's paradise. Over or improper consumption may lead to nutritional deficiencies.
Even the Japanese can't save lutefisk, not with all the wasabi in the world.

Crunch-munch! Chew-chew! Snuffle-slurp! Crunch-munch! Chew-chew! Snuffle-slurp! Oh wait, there seems to be a note stuck in the bottom of the bowl; you'll have to eat your dinner to get to it. You've heard of messages written on the bottoms of glasses, but this is ridiculous.
Looking at this little piece of chewy candy, you can see how it might fill your belly, but the manufacturer's claims about it raising your IQ is another kettle of fish altogether.
Fills the Belly, but...
It's a poffin creatively shaped like a cake. Its conflicts with pie have been some of the bloodiest (and creamiest) throughout history.
A huge and delicious apple. You'd better not let the Guildmaster catch you eating this! YOOM-TAH! Fills your belly a lot and increases its size for a little while.

It's a dastardly combination of both cake AND pie, the eating of which will create a temporal paradox of rich deliciousness which may or may not subsequently cause the destruction of Temporal Tower and the planet's paralysis. You can still eat it if you're willing to brave the effects, though.

This pokemon egg moves a little every now and then; it's obviously almost about to hatch. WHATEVER YOU DO, DON'T EAT THIS. I WARNED you. Take it to Brax, he'll find a good home for it and pay you a pretty penny in the bargain.
Shake it this way...shake it that way... and stir it all around...and it's done!
It's a can of lemonade. Odd how you never see people drinking these, but giving them to pokemon instead...
A very sweet and thoroughly unhealthy drink. Why are you even considering putting this anywhere close to your mouth?
It's a traditional clay cup of green tea. All you need now is a small table, a couple of cushions, and a plate of steamed buns.
It's wine, only in a horribly expensive crystal wineglass. Or maybe it's just plastic - you can't tell.
Remember, kids. Eat your greens, drink your milk, brush your teeth and stay in school.
Moderately sweet, the natural flavour promises to come bursting forth from this drink. An indescribably wonderful flavour...a special blend for both the discerning pokemon and you.
A marvellous blend of fruit flavours swirls in this dessert wine.

Ever wondered how the minotaurs on the covers of bodybuilding magazines look like that? It's because they grew up on this thick, rich and creamy stuff. Legal production of minotaur milk is strictly controlled by the minotaur matriarchs, who maintain a Bolt Council-like death grip on the flow to keep prices sky-high. Illegal minotaur milk production usually involves young, desperate minotaur women, shady, unhygenic milking parlours, and various criminal organisations. Either way, there's a lot of guilt associated with this milk.
A tempest in a bottle.

You imagine drinking the amazing miracle drink. !!!!!! Never before has a heavenly, super-special, incredible, miracle-combination flavour like this been experienced! Right now, right here, you are dreaming of enjoying a flavour that is out of this world! Obscene stat boosts sold separately.
A bottle of water with high mineral content, blown in by the North Wind. Refreshment guaranteed.
Boosts your Attack. Since you're not a pokemon, the effect is only temporary.
Boosts your Defense; usually made by boiling up an anchor and straining off the residue. Since you're not a pokemon, the effect is only temporary.
Boosts your Speed; the most commonly abused substance at the pokeathlon and the reason for mandatory vitamin tests. Since you're not a pokemon, the effect is only temporary.
Boosts your Special Attack. Since you're not a pokemon, the effect is only temporary.
Boosts your Special Defense. Since you're not a pokemon, the effect is only temporary.
Normally, this would boost the power of a pokemon's move, but you're not one. It's still a powerful tonic, best taken when reduced to a syrup after boiling 40 times.
They're here. Does anything and everything.

Short for Rancid Orcish Imitation Dietary Supplements, these nasty and addictive pills are handed out to Dredmor's assembly-line workers to make them work harder, faster, and on less sleep. Overdosing will mess up your body, so watch it.
When you bought this game, you were promised the chance to stuff aluminum powder up your nostrils. Now you can do that - and more. This is an addictive substance - overdosing will NOT help you.

'Hello, friendly friends! It's great that you're out exploring and all, but don't forget the three top rules for exploration teams! One! Don't shirk work! Two! Run away and pay! Three! Smiles go for miles! Yoom-tah!'

'Dear Horrible Thief: Please stop selling me all your gold ribbons, picking them up, and using a pure seed to warp to the stairs before I can beat you to a pulp. We all hate you so much. Yours Faithfully, the Kecleon Brothers.'

'You know, you don't have to be so hopelessly shy. I still remember when we were first starting out; you actually had to look at a notice board to figure out how to talk to me when I was standing right next to you! I thought you'd gotten over it, but just yesterday you had a Sky Gift delivered to me at the Shaymin Village. When I was standing next to you. I think we have a few issues we need to sort out...'
Oh, look; it's a map to a new exploration area that only you know about! Too bad you've left your Wonder Map behind, and even if you didn't, you're still stuck in this dungeon without an Escape Orb.
'Looking for someone to lug my sorry behind through a restricted dungeon and waste all their time for a couple of golden gummis and apples at the end of it all. Golden seeds? Nah, no such luck.'

'Gee, I don't know why my boyfriend ended up twenty-two levels deep in the middle of goodness knows where, but I desperately need to see him anyways. You know, I'll just hang around, be completely useless, and waste all your reviver seeds as I get myself wrecked over and over again by room-effect moves. Oh, and then I'll faint, somehow making YOU lose your loot, not to mention your mobile scarf, golden mask and goggle specs. Well, will you take me along?'

'ZZZT! I am Officer Magnezone, the local arm of the law. ZZZT! I have a thoroughly annoying way of speaking. ZZZT! My underlings and I are hopelessly incompetent, primarily because we are pathetically underlevelled. ZZZT! No wonder we can't do much and instead need exploration teams to do our work for us. ZZZT!'

'Golly, I've just had a hankering to take in the sights of somewhere really wild and dangerous, and would like an exploration team to take me on a holiday in a place where serious bodily harm might easily come to my person! I don't even know what I want to see or where I want to stop, so I'll leave the destination floor blank and you'll have to trek through the whole dungeon!'

'Let's go treasure hunting together! Oddly enough, I won't demand any of the often rare spoils, and will actually reward you for taking me out anyway! I guess the life experience really is the best reward, not the loot!'

'Help! I appear to have done something stupid and gotten myself knocked out! Problem is, I want to keep all the loot in MY treasure bag, which means some poor sap like you is going to have to trek out and save me!'
A tightly-sealed box; something inside rattles when you shake it. Will you open it up by using it on yourself, or sell it as it is?
A tightly-sealed box; something inside thunks about when you shake it. Will you open it up by using it on yourself, or sell it as it is?
What appears to be a treasure chest full of loot. Open it up, or not risk it and sell it to Brax?
A tightly-sealed capsule, used to secure loot. Will you open it up by using it on yourself, or sell it as it is?
This lovely take-away hamper is often given away at Bolt Council community-liasion fairs. Open it up to find what's inside!
An old dragon skull, perhaps part of a long-rotted trophy. Whatever will you make with this?
This enormous, flat obsidian crystal gleams with an inner fire. You can't be sure if it really is a fallen scale from the draconic mother goddess, but it's definitely special in some way.
A sword blank made from a strange substance. It feels cold to the touch.
This slender and elegant bone rapier gives you a small chance turn your dodges into counterattacks.

'I never cared about justice, and I don't ever recall calling myself a hero...I have always only fought for the people that I believe in. I won't hesitate...if an enemy appears before me, I will destroy it!'
Each blade of this three-bladed sword has a different edge. The blades look like they're arguing.

This gleaming sword embodies the Musketeer Quartet's signature move of the same name. It not just slices through your primary target's defensive stats, but also cuts a swathe through adjacent foes in a triple battle.
Earth! Wind! Water! Fire! No, you can't join in - what kind of lame power is Heart, anyway?

'The name's Arcadion,' the demon trapped within the blade growls. 'NOT Alastor. Remember that, and don't you dare say 'round trip' in my presence. So, what'll you be having tonight, fire or magic? I don't do death any more.'
This sharp little fang has a small chance of causing an opponent to flinch (or in Japanese, cringe) when you strike with it, making them lose their turn.
If you stab someone and there is no one around to see it, did it really happen?
Sliced with the wind.
This small, flat sword helps you block incoming blows and has a small chance of allowing you to counterattack after a successful block.
A stick of charcoal that serves well enough for clobbering monsters. Also handy for starting a fire.
You didn't know there were any good fishing spots in the dungeon, or you'd have brought your cooler and tackle box.
A thick green slime covers the shaft of this spear, and an equally foul stench rises from the edge. Are you REALLY sure you want to be using this thing?
First conceived of by a dragon's personal dentist (who subsequently became very rich), the point of this spear is shaped from a dragon's tooth.
A magical lance of the sort knights throw at ghouls and ghosts, only considerably souped up.

With all the work in recent years, what with the elves and dwarves and so many young people taking degrees in dungeoneering, Death's had to step up his game to deal with the increased workload. He's still got enough pride in his work not to turn to outsourcing, but has come up with a number of work-saving innovations, and this obsidian-bladed scythe is based on one of those.
An old, floppy fish. Parts of it are starting to peel and come off when you hit enemies with it.

A reasonably fresh fish, reputed for leaping out of the water and clamping down on unlucky anglers' mouths. After rings fell out of popularity following the Mount Damn Incident, this lovely pink fish was used in marriage proposals for a while.
This species of fish has been blessed by the Lutefisk God, blinging it out immensely, and is revered by its worshippers as having some small part of the god's divinity.
A hunk of never-melting ice. Since you don't really know any ice-type moves, all you need now is a cooler to put it in...
A pile of vile and sticky black goo. Ick. Thank goodness it doesn't drain your health over time.
Made with the dead to fight the dead, this bony mace deals additional damage to evil creatures.
'Now you vermin will feel the full force of my birthright - the fury of the earth itself!'
The edge of this axe drips with blood. It has the ability to heal you with an enemy's life-force when you land a critical hit.
Forged with dragon bone, this heavy axe allows you to use your critical hits to identify and expose your enemies' weaknesses.
An axe with a dark, sharp obsidian blade that seems to both gleam and draw in all light at the same time, no matter how impossible that may sound.

Used by Elves against Dwarves to great effect in the war, this bow is skilfully crafted from dead wood. As opposed to living wood, which has a tendency to whimper and moan most unsettlingly when one draws the bow.
The hushed whispers of the dead echo in the bowstring of this grim bone bow, hungry for the breath of others.
Finally, someone's come up with one of these that DOESN'T involve tattoos.
This clear, armoured shell is wrought from alchemical processing of fossilized dragon bone to draw out every last iota of latent power.

This light yet sturdy bone cuirass is a little grim-looking. Sometimes, you hear old, deep voices in your head urging you to do things like not eating your greens or drinking your milk! Oh, the horror!
Infused with powdered dragonbone, this suit of armour shields you from forces both phyiscal and magical.
Doesn't ANYONE know that precious metals are most impractical for making armour?
This breastplate is no obsidian scale cloak, being heavy and hefty, but will very definitely keep you cool through the deep breathing with all your extremities intact.
This nifty little lens fits over your eye well enough and ups your critical-hit ratio.
Not only does this nifty little lens fit over your eye well enough, it also protects you from horrible lens flare and ups your accuracy.
Enhances vision.
This nifty little lens allows you to sometimes strike more than once in a turn.
The dull, white gleam in the sockets of this skull-turned-helm makes your enemies pause. Speak the words of power and send them flying!
Now who's looking all fine and dandy today?
This obsidian helm is light yet sturdy, gleaming in the dungeon's light. A little hard to see out of, though.
Does being cool really mean having to bump into every single thing in the dungeon? Who cares? You're cool. Cool people don't care about bruises. Or pain. Or bleeding. Or death.
This lustrous silk scarf powers up your normal-type moves, or the closest analogue thereof.
No star can glow with a broken heart.
Wisps of light play over the reflective surface of this amulet, the sort of which priestly types hold out against the forces of darkness during the climactic scene of a horror movie.
A brilliant light pulses at the heart of this clear glass orb.
This roll of gleaming metallic film looks thin enough to bake food in, but is sturdy enough to take a few blows.
A glowing orb once held by a ghostly dragon, even though it isn't very orb-shaped. Although you don't know any dragon or ghost-type moves, you can still feel its power.
A glowing orb once held by a temporal dragon, even though it isn't very orb-shaped. Although you don't know any dragon or steel-type moves, you can still feel its power.
A glowing orb once held by a spatial dragon. Although you don't know any dragon or water-type moves, you can still feel its power.
1. Fall from an airship and onto a goddess' head. 2. Get made royalty. 3. Go farming. 4. ????? 5. Profit!
At a first glance, you think it's a strategy guide to the newest board game from Inferno Diversions, but upon closer examination it's just a gem-studded tome on smithing. Boo.
Years in the making, this guide is the sequel to the best-selling Soulcraft.
Another book by the code-wizard Null, this book promises to make you the master of winds in a sealed-off dungeon with no access to the sky.
Authored by the great code-wizard Null, this popular book is a must-have for diggers, delvers, and all other spleunky-types.

item.name: Shocking Revelations of a Charged Mind

description.text: This biography of the wizard Tesla focuses on his little-known youth, the young wizard's exploits as an apprentice and the beginnings of his love with all things electric.

This series of thick, scholary tomes is covered in crabbed handwriting by the archivist J-Factor, and holds everything you'll ever want to know about Dredmor and his minions. Unfortunately, there's simply so much that it'd take you more than your lifetime to read it all; this thick volume you hold proclaims itself as 'The guide to dangerous mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians, fish, jellyfish, insects, spiders, crustaceans, grasses, trees, mosses and lichens of the Dungeons of Dredmor, volume 29C, part three'.

Draconic runes are etched onto the borders of the shield: 'Because the wise amongst us realise that all nations, all peoples, even us, are no more to Her than any other, for everything will be gone in the end and new, different creatures will take their place. But She and the land is, was, and ever will be, until her father awakens, until the end of time.'
Contrary to popular belief, this sash won't keep you from fainting. It'll still help, though.
This belt ups the power of your fighting-type moves, whatever those are.
Aah, no better material to guard your vulnerables than awfully sharp volcanic glass, is there? You must be a very strong, brave and daring person!
So, I heard you liked these.
This small ring has cheap runes of protection etched into it.
A small hoop of dragonbone, polished to a shine. Somehow, wearing this makes you feel immensely powerful.
This little trinket of gold on obsidian is a fount of wisdom in the palm of your hand.
Covered in steel plates and weighted with concrete, these boots will give your feet a solid kick.
Because the Japanese do everything better, even boots to the head.
Walk a mile in someone's shoes, so the saying goes - never said anything about walking a mile in someone's bones.
Seems like a shame to track these all over the dirty dungeon floor.
Despite being plated in obsidian, these boots are surprisingly light on your feet. You could cross lava on these, if it were hard enough to walk on.
These gloves protect your hands while you embrace nature by hacking and digging at it.
For when you need to get a good grip on your enemies.
The palms of these gauntlets feel extremely warm. No flowers needed - let's get to throwing some fire.
These pants may proclaim that you are indeed a bad dude (or dudette, for that matter), but are you bad enough to rescue the presiden- I mean, king?
A blank Technical Machine. It currently has no move recorded onto it, but still has a reasonably sharp edge.
A strangely aerodynamic knight's lance. Throw this at ghouls and ghosts for best effect.
A strangely aerodynamic knight's lance. Throw this at enemies to knock them back.
A strangely aerodynamic knight's lance for gold-armoured knights. Throw this at ghouls and ghosts for best effect.
You are the milkman. Your milk is delicious. Special delivery today.
A bottle of cooking oil, perfect for frying things with.
A Technical Machine, or TM for short. It currently holds the move Powder Snow, which will create a weak snowfield where the TM hits.
A Technical Machine, or TM for short. It currently holds the move Stealth Rock, which will create trap of pointed stones where the TM hits.
A Technical Machine, or TM for short. It currently holds the move Smog, which creates a cloud of poison smog where the TM hits.
A Technical Machine, or TM for short. It currently holds the move Poison Jab, which deals toxic and acidic damage.
A small sliver of ice, perfect for freezing your enemies to the spot.
Not a perfect substitute for a magic missile, but you can still cast it into the darkness.
These glimmering bolts have the ability to temporarily suppress their target's magics.
This bolt bursts into a massive blast of divine wrath. Stand well away!
This little gizmo allows you to temporarily take control of a construct - if the manual override manages to kick in, that is.
When activated, this trap sprays slick, flammable oil all over the place.
Designed by Boyd Cooper to keep imaginary government agents off his lawn, this trap explodes in a blossom of flammable milk.
